medical_history.chief_complaint: Inflammatory prosthetic knee pain associated with swelling of the joint.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 45 days prior with a nonspecific, self-limited episode of fever for 1 week. No other fever syndrome was present at the time of current presentation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Arterial hypertension, herpes zoster, nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugâ€“induced digestive hemorrhages, and total knee replacement performed 5 years before current visit.
medical_history.social_history: The patient had handled, sacrificed, and eviscerated 2 lambs at his farm, which is located in an area where brucellosis is endemic.
